name: Admiral (U.K.)
substitutes: U.K. Target, U.K. Northdown, U.K. Challenger
characteristics: Known for its bittering potential.

name: Ahtanum
characteristics: Floral, citrus, sharp, and piney.

name: Amarillo
characteristics: Citrusy, flowery.

name: Bramling Cross (U.K.)
substitutes: U.K. Kent Golding, U.K. Progress, Whitbread Golding Variety
characteristics: Quite mild, fruity currant aroma.

name: Brewer's Gold
characteristics: Bittering hop with neutral aroma character.

name: Brewer's Gold (German)
characteristics: Black currant, fruity, spicy.

name: Bullion
substitutes: Columbus, Northern Brewer, German Brewer's Gold
characteristics: A rich hop primarily used for bittering. Intense blackcurrant aroma.

name: Cascade
characteristics: Pleasant, flowery, spicy, and citrusy. Can have a grapefruit flavor.

name: Centennial
styles: All ale styles, has been used with wheat beer
characteristics: Medium with floral and citrus tones.

name: Challenger (U.K.)
styles: English-style ales, porter, stout, ESB, bitter
substitutes: U.S. or German Perle, Northern Brewer
characteristics: Mild to moderate, quite spicy.

name: Chinook
styles: Pale ale, IPA, stout, porter, lager
substitutes: Nugget, Columbus, Northern Brewer, U.K. Target
characteristics: Mild to medium-heavy, spicy, piney, and grapefruity.

name: Cluster
styles: Ale and lager (good aroma for ale, good bittering for lager)
characteristics: Medium and quite spicy.

name: Columbus
substitutes: Nugget, Chinook, U.K. Target, Northern Brewer
characteristics: Pleasant, with pungent aroma.

name: Crystal
substitutes: Mt. Hood, Hersbrucker, French Strisslespalt, Liberty, Hallertauer
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, spicy and flowery.

name: Eroica
characteristics: Strong but pleasant aroma.

name: First Gold (U.K.)
characteristics: A little like Golding family; spicy.

name: Fuggle (U.S.)
styles: Any English-style beer or American ale
substitutes: U.K. Fuggle, Willamette, Styrian Golding, U.S. Tettnanger
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, earthy and fruity.

name: Fuggle (U.K.)
styles: All English-style ales, ESB, bitter, lager
characteristics: Mild, pleasant, hoppy, and robust.

name: Galena
characteristics: Medium but pleasant hoppiness, citrusy.

name: Golding (U.S.)
styles: Pale ale, ESB, all English-style beer
substitutes: U.K. Golding, Whitbread Golding Variety, U.K. Progress, and possibly the Fuggle family
characteristics: Mild, extremely pleasant, and gently hoppy.

name: Hallertauer (U.S.)
characteristics: Very mild, pleasant, and slightly flowery, some spicy.

name: Hallertauer Gold
characteristics: Known for its aromatic properties similar to Hallertauer.

name: Hallertauer Mittelfrüh
characteristics: Mild and pleasant.

name: Hallertauer Tradition (Ger.)
characteristics: Known for its aromatic properties. A replacement for Hallertauer Mittelfrüh.

name: Hersbrucker (German)
characteristics: Mild to semi-strong, pleasant, hoppy.

name: Horizon
characteristics: Pleasantly hoppy.

name: Kent Golding (U.K.)
substitutes: U.S. Golding, Whitbread Golding Variety, U.K. Progress
characteristics: Gentle, fragrant, and pleasant.

name: Liberty
characteristics: Mild and clean aroma, slightly spicy character.

name: Magnum
styles: All beers, particularly lager, pilsner, stout
characteristics: Known for bittering value and quality.

name: Mt. Hood
characteristics: Mild, pleasant, and clean, somewhat pungent and resiny.

name: Northdown (U.K.)
characteristics: Fruity with some spiciness.

name: Northern Brewer (U.S.)
styles: ESB, bitter, English pale ale, porter, California (steam) beer
characteristics: Medium-strong with some wild tones.

name: Northern Brewer (German)
styles: ESB, bitter, English pale ale, porter
characteristics: Medium-strong with some wild tones.

name: Northwest Golding
characteristics: Known for aromatic properties.

name: Nugget
characteristics: Quite heavy and herbal.

name: Olympic
characteristics: Mild to medium, citrusy aroma, spicy.

name: Perle (U.S.)
characteristics: Known for its aromatic and bittering properties, pleasant and slightly spicy.

name: Perle (German)
characteristics: Moderately intense, good and hoppy, fruity and a little spicy.

name: Phoenix (U.K.)
substitutes: U.K. Northdown, U.K. Kent Golding, U.K. Challenger
characteristics: Similar to U.K. Challenger.

name: Pioneer (U.K.)
characteristics: A mild, typical English aroma.

name: Polish Lublin
substitutes: U.S. Saaz, Czech Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger
characteristics: Mild and typical of noble aroma types, spicy, herbal.

name: Pride of Ringwood (Australia)
characteristics: Quite pronounced, woody, earthy, herbal.

name: Progress (U.K.)
characteristics: Moderately strong, good aroma.

name: Saaz (Czech)
characteristics: Very mild with pleasant hoppy notes, earthy, spicy, and herbal.

name: Saaz (U.S.)
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, earthy and spicy.

name: Santiam
substitutes: German Tettnanger, German Spalt, German Spalt Select
characteristics: Noble characteristics.

name: Satus
characteristics: Known for its bittering and aromatic properties.

name: Simcoe
characteristics: A bittering and aromatic hop.

name: Spalt (German)
substitutes: U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger, German Spalt Select
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy.

name: Spalt Select (German)
styles: Lager, and any beer where noble aroma is wanted
substitutes: U.S. Saaz, U.S. Tettnanger, German Spalt
characteristics: Very fine Spalter-type aroma.

name: Spalt Select (U.S.)
characteristics: Medium intensity and pleasant hoppy qualities. Medium-strong aroma with wild American tones.

name: Sterling
characteristics: Herbal, spicy, pleasant aroma, hint of floral and citrus.

name: Strisslespalt (France)
characteristics: Medium intensity, pleasant, hoppy.

name: Styrian Golding (Slovenia)
styles: All English-style ales, ESB, bitter, lager
characteristics: Delicate, slightly spicy.

name: Target (U.K.)
characteristics: Pleasant English hop aroma, quite intense.

name: Tettnanger (U.S.)
styles: German ales and lagers, American lagers, wheat
characteristics: An aromatic hop, mild and slightly spicy.

name: Tettnanger (German)
substitutes: German Spalt, German Spalt Select, U.S. Tettnanger, Saaz
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, herbal.

name: Tomahawk
characteristics: Primarily a bittering hop.

name: Tradition (German)
characteristics: Very fine and similar to Hallertauer Mittelfrüh.

name: Ultra
styles: Lager, pilsner, wheat, finish hop in ales
characteristics: Very good to outstanding, some Saaz-like qualities. Aromatic properties similar to Hallertauer.

name: Vanguard
characteristics: Aroma similar to continental European types.

name: Warrior
characteristics: A bittering and aromatic hop.

name: WGV (Whitbread Golding Variety) (U.K.)
characteristics: Quite pleasant and hoppy, moderately intense.

name: Willamette
styles: Pale ale, ESB, bitter, English-style ale, porter, stout
substitutes: U.S. Fuggle, U.S. Tettnanger, Styrian Golding
characteristics: Mild and pleasant, slightly spicy, fruity, floral, a little earthy.

name: Yakima Cluster
characteristics: Used as a kettle hop for bittering.

name: Zeus
characteristics: Aromatic and pleasant.
